Key Match Events: Cristian Javier recorded just one out, allowing three runs and four hits in the first inning.
Houston Astros lost to Texas Rangers 11-4 in ALCS Game 7.
Corey Seager hit a 440-foot home run.
Evan Carter walked, stole second base, and scored on a single by Adolis García.
Adolis García stole second and scored on a pop-fly single by Mitch Garver.
Alex Bregman hit a solo homer in the bottom of the third inning.
Evan Carter hit a two-run double and Adolis García hit a two-run single in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Dusty Baker expressed that the team has nothing to be ashamed of despite the loss.
Third baseman Alex Bregman reflected on the team's lack of execution compared to previous years.
Catcher Martín Maldonado commented on Cristian Javier's struggles with command and off-speed pitches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston Astros went 39-42 at Minute Maid Park during the regular season and 1-5 at home in the playoffs.
No team with a losing record at home has ever reached the World Series.
Houston Astros are the only big league team to lose four home games in a seven-game postseason series.
